main event: A circular, ovate-shaped object was sighted over Christiansburg, Ohio for 10-15 seconds on November 8, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared suddenly at a high rate of speed and passed out of sight in a circular direction.
The object's color and brightness were not specified in the report.
The witness was unable to determine the exact distance to the object, but estimated it was about 1 mile away.
The Air Force's conclusions were that the sighting was 'Probably Aircraft, Possibly Satellite, Probable Astronomical'.
The witness did not report the sighting to law enforcement, but the report indicates the witness may have reported it to the Air Force.
